CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canJump(nums)
        ASSIGN 0 TO positionIndex
        ASSIGN 0 TO maximumReach

        WHILE positionIndex LESS THAN LENGTH(nums)
            IF NOT(positionIndex LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO maximumReach)
                OUTPUT false
                EXIT FUNCTION
            END IF

            ASSIGN (positionIndex PLUS nums[positionIndex]) TO candidateReach
            IF candidateReach GREATER THAN maximumReach
                ASSIGN candidateReach TO maximumReach
            END IF

            INCREMENT positionIndex BY 1
        END WHILE

        IF maximumReach GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO (LENGTH(nums) MINUS 1)
            OUTPUT true
            EXIT FUNCTION
        END IF

        OUTPUT false
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF farthest GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the LENGTH OF nums MINUS one  
            RETURN true  
        ELSE  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION uniquePaths(m n)  
        SET matrix AS a list containing m elements, each being a list of length n filled with 1  
        SET rowIndex TO 1  
        WHILE rowIndex < m DO  
            SET columnIndex TO 1  
            WHILE columnIndex < n DO  
                SET currentRow TO matrix[rowIndex]  
                SET currentRow[columnIndex] TO matrix[rowIndex - 1][columnIndex] + currentRow[columnIndex - 1]  
                SET columnIndex TO columnIndex + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET rowIndex TO rowIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN matrix[m - 1][n - 1]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION combine(n, k)
        FUNCTION backtrack(begin, sequence)
            IF NOT (LENGTH(sequence) NOT EQUAL TO k)
                result COLLECT COPY(sequence)
                RETURN
            END IF
            SET index TO begin
            WHILE index < n + 1
                sequence ADD index
                backtrack(index + 1, sequence)
                sequence REMOVE LAST
                index INCREASE BY 1
            END WHILE
        END FUNCTION
        result ASSIGN LIST()
        backtrack(1, LIST())
        RETURN result
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION combine WITH PARAMETERS n k  
        FUNCTION backtrack WITH PARAMETERS start path  
            IF the LENGTH OF path EQUALS k  
                APPEND a COPY OF path TO result  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            FOR i FROM start TO n PLUS one  
                APPEND i TO path  
                CALL backtrack WITH ARGUMENTS i PLUS one path  
                REMOVE the LAST ELEMENT FROM path  
            END FOR  
        END FUNCTION  
        SET result TO an EMPTY LIST  
        CALL backtrack WITH ARGUMENTS one AN EMPTY LIST  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        DECLARE result AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE temp AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE bitmask AS integer  
        DECLARE index AS integer  
        
        IF NOT (n NOT EQUALS 0) THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        SET temp AS grayCode(n - 1)  
        SET bitmask AS 1 << (n - 1)  
        
        SET result AS temp  
        SET index TO LENGTH(temp) - 1  
        
        WHILE index GREATER OR EQUAL TO 0 DO  
            APPEND (temp[index] BITWISE_OR bitmask) TO result  
            DECREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET mask TO one MULTIPLIED BY two RAISED TO the power of n MINUS one  
        SET current_gray TO concatenation of prev_gray WITH a list constructed by taking each number IN the reversed prev_gray AND applying bitwise OR with mask  
        RETURN current_gray  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET length_s AS the LENGTH OF s  
        
        IF NOT (length_s GREATER THAN one)  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET palindrome_flag TO a list of length_s elements each containing a list of length_s elements initialized to FALSE  
        
        SET idx TO zero  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length_s  
            SET palindrome_flag[idx][idx] AS TRUE  
            INCREMENT idx BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET substr_len TO two  
        WHILE substr_len LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s  
            SET start_pos TO zero  
            WHILE start_pos LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s MINUS substr_len  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos PLUS substr_len MINUS one  
                
                IF substr_len EQUALS two THEN  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                ELSE  
                    SET chars_match AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                    SET inner_palindrome AS palindrome_flag[start_pos PLUS one][end_pos MINUS one]  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (chars_match AND inner_palindrome)  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT start_pos BY one  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT substr_len BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET min_cut_counts TO a list of length_s elements initialized as zero  
        
        SET i TO zero  
        WHILE i LESS THAN length_s  
            IF palindrome_flag[zero][i] THEN  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS zero  
            ELSE  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS positive infinity  
                SET j TO one  
                WHILE j LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO i  
                    IF palindrome_flag[j][i] AND ((min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one) LESS THAN min_cut_counts[i]) THEN  
                        SET min_cut_counts[i] AS (min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one)  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN min_cut_counts[length_s MINUS one]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO one  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET is_palindrome TO a two dimensional collection of size n by n filled with FALSE  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            SET element at position i at position i of is_palindrome TO TRUE  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR length FROM two TO n  
            FOR start FROM zero TO n MINUS length  
                SET end TO start PLUS length MINUS one  
                IF length EQUALS two  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s  
                ELSE  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s AND the element at position start PLUS one at position end MINUS one of is_palindrome  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        SET min_cuts TO a collection of size n filled with zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF element at position zero at position i of is_palindrome  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO zero  
            ELSE  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO positive infinity  
                FOR j FROM one TO i  
                    IF element at position j at position i of is_palindrome AND element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one LESS THAN element at position i of min_cuts  
                        SET element at position i of min_cuts TO element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position n MINUS one of min_cuts  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        DECLARE polarity AS string  
        IF (numerator < 0 AND denominator >= 0) OR (numerator >= 0 AND denominator < 0) THEN  
            polarity ← "-"  
        ELSE  
            polarity ← ""  
        ENDIF  
  
        numerator ← ABS(numerator)  
        denominator ← ABS(denominator)  
  
        DECLARE integralQuotient AS integer ← numerator DIV denominator  
        DECLARE modValue AS integer ← numerator MOD denominator  
        DECLARE integerString AS string ← TO_STRING(integralQuotient)  
  
        IF modValue = 0 THEN  
            RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString)  
        ENDIF  
  
        DECLARE remainderPositions AS MAP FROM integer TO integer ← EMPTY MAP  
        DECLARE digits AS LIST OF string ← EMPTY LIST  
  
        DECLARE currentRemainder AS integer ← modValue  
        WHILE currentRemainder ≠ 0 DO  
            IF remainderPositions CONTAINS currentRemainder THEN  
                DECLARE cycleStart AS integer ← remainderPositions[currentRemainder]  
                DECLARE prefix AS string ← ""  
                DECLARE suffix AS string ← ""  
                FOR idx FROM 0 TO cycleStart - 1 DO  
                    prefix ← CONCAT(prefix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                FOR idx FROM cycleStart TO LENGTH(digits) - 1 DO  
                    suffix ← CONCAT(suffix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", prefix, "(", suffix, ")")  
            ENDIF  
  
            remainderPositions[currentRemainder] ← LENGTH(digits)  
  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder * 10  
            DECLARE digitValue AS integer ← currentRemainder DIV denominator  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder MOD denominator  
            APPEND TO digits: TO_STRING(digitValue)  
        ENDWHILE  
  
        RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", JOIN(digits))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        IF numerator LESS THAN zero AND denominator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero OR numerator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND denominator LESS THAN zero  
            SET sign TO the string indicating negative  
        ELSE  
            SET sign TO the empty string  
        END IF  
  
        SET numerator TO the absolute value of numerator  
        SET denominator TO the absolute value of denominator  
  
        SET quotient TO the integer division result of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET remainder TO the remainder of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET integer_part TO the string representation of quotient  
  
        IF remainder EQUALS zero  
            RETURN the concatenation of sign and integer_part  
        END IF  
  
        SET seen_remainders TO an empty mapping from remainder values to positions  
        SET fractional_part TO an empty list  
  
        WHILE remainder NOT EQUALS zero  
            IF remainder EXISTS AS a key in seen_remainders  
                SET start TO the value associated with remainder in seen_remainders  
                SET non_repeating TO the concatenation of elements from position zero UP TO position start EXCLUDING start in fractional_part  
                SET repeating TO the concatenation of elements FROM position start TO the end of fractional_part  
                RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, non_repeating, the opening parenthesis string, repeating, and the closing parenthesis string  
            END IF  
  
            ASSIGN to seen_remainders at key remainder the current length of fractional_part  
  
            SET remainder TO remainder MULTIPLIED BY ten  
            SET quotient TO the integer division result of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            SET remainder TO the remainder of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            APPEND the string representation of quotient TO fractional_part  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, and the concatenation of all elements in fractional_part  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)  
        INITIALIZE dp AS a list WITH (n + 1) elements EACH SET TO infinity_value  
        ASSIGN dp[0] ← 0  
        INITIALIZE squares AS an empty list  
        ASSIGN counter ← 1  
        LOOP  
            IF (counter * counter) > n THEN EXIT LOOP  
            ADD (counter * counter) TO squares  
            SET counter ← counter + 1  
        END LOOP  
        ASSIGN index ← 1  
        WHILE index ≤ n DO  
            FOR EACH current_square IN squares DO  
                IF current_square > index THEN  
                    EXIT FOR  
                ELSE  
                    TEMP ← dp[index - current_square] + 1  
                    IF TEMP < dp[index] THEN  
                        SET dp[index] ← TEMP  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            SET index ← index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET the element at position zero of dp TO zero  
        SET squares TO an empty list  
        SET i TO one  
        WHILE i MULTIPLIED BY i IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            APPEND i MULTIPLIED BY i TO squares  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        FOR i FROM one TO n  
            FOR each square IN squares  
                IF i IS LESS THAN square  
                    BREAK the inner loop  
                END IF  
                SET dp at position i TO the smaller value BETWEEN dp at position i AND dp at position i MINUS square PLUS one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)
        DECLARE cache AS an empty map

        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)
            IF NOT (state NOT IN cache) THEN
                RETURN cache[state]
            END IF

            DECLARE iterator AS 0
            WHILE iterator <= LENGTH(state) - 2 DO
                IF (state[iterator] = '+') AND (state[iterator + 1] = '+') THEN
                    DECLARE before_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, 0, iterator)
                    DECLARE after_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, iterator + 2, LENGTH(state))
                    DECLARE candidate_state AS CONCATENATE(before_segment, '--', after_segment)

                    IF FALSE = can_win_helper(candidate_state) THEN
                        ASSIGN TRUE TO cache[state]
                        RETURN TRUE
                    END IF
                END IF
                ASSIGN iterator + 1 TO iterator
            END WHILE

            ASSIGN FALSE TO cache[state]
            RETURN FALSE
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN can_win_helper(currentState)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)  
        SET memo TO an empty dictionary  
        
        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)  
            IF state EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN the value associated with state in memo  
            END IF  
            
            FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF state MINUS one MINUS one  
                IF the element at position index of state EQUALS the plus character AND the element at position index PLUS one of state EQUALS the plus character THEN  
                    SET new_state TO the substring from position zero TO position index MINUS one CONCATENATED WITH two minus characters CONCATENATED WITH the substring from position index PLUS two TO the END OF state  
                    IF the result of calling can_win_helper WITH new_state IS EQUAL TO false THEN  
                        SET the value associated with state in memo TO true  
                        RETURN true  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            SET the value associated with state in memo TO false  
            RETURN false  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN the result of calling can_win_helper WITH currentState  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)
        DECLARE char_sets AS empty list
        DECLARE idx1 AS 0
        WHILE idx1 < LENGTH(words)
            DECLARE temp_set AS empty set
            DECLARE pos AS 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(words[idx1])
                SET temp_set TO temp_set UNION { words[idx1][pos] }
                SET pos TO pos + 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND temp_set TO char_sets
            SET idx1 TO idx1 + 1
        END WHILE

        SET highest_product TO 0

        DECLARE first_pointer AS 0
        WHILE first_pointer < LENGTH(words) - 1
            DECLARE second_pointer AS first_pointer + 1
            WHILE second_pointer < LENGTH(words)
                DECLARE intersection_check AS char_sets[first_pointer] INTERSECT char_sets[second_pointer]
                IF LENGTH(intersection_check) = 0 THEN
                    DECLARE candidate_product AS (LENGTH(words[first_pointer]) * LENGTH(words[second_pointer]))
                    IF candidate_product > highest_product THEN
                        SET highest_product TO candidate_product
                    END IF
                END IF
                SET second_pointer TO second_pointer + 1
            END WHILE
            SET first_pointer TO first_pointer + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN highest_product
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)  
        SET cache AS a list containing (amount + 1) copies of (amount + 1)  
        ASSIGN 0 TO cache[0]  

        SET counter TO 1  
        WHILE counter ≤ amount  
            SET currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            FOR each denomination IN coins  
                SET remainder TO counter - denomination  
                IF remainder ≥ 0 THEN  
                    SET candidate TO cache[remainder] + 1  
                    IF candidate < currentMin THEN  
                        ASSIGN candidate TO currentMin  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            ASSIGN currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF cache[amount] ≠ (amount + 1) THEN  
            RETURN cache[amount]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION originalDigits(s)  
        SET freqMap AS map of character counts in s  
        SET digitCounts AS list WITH TEN elements INITIATED TO 0  
        
        SET digitCounts[0] AS freqMap['z']  
        SET digitCounts[2] AS freqMap['w']  
        SET digitCounts[4] AS freqMap['u']  
        SET digitCounts[6] AS freqMap['x']  
        SET digitCounts[8] AS freqMap['g']  
        
        SET digitCounts[3] AS freqMap['h'] - digitCounts[8]  
        SET digitCounts[5] AS freqMap['f'] - digitCounts[4]  
        SET digitCounts[7] AS freqMap['s'] - digitCounts[6]  
        
        SET tempI AS freqMap['i']  
        SET digitCounts[9] AS tempI - digitCounts[5] - digitCounts[6] - digitCounts[8]  
        
        SET tempO AS freqMap['o']  
        SET digitCounts[1] AS tempO - digitCounts[0] - digitCounts[2] - digitCounts[4]  
        
        SET collectionOfChars AS empty list  
        
        SET numberIdx AS 0  
        WHILE numberIdx LESS THAN 10  
            SET countRepeat AS digitCounts[numberIdx]  
            WHILE countRepeat GREATER THAN 0  
                APPEND STRING(numberIdx) TO collectionOfChars  
                ASSIGN countRepeat ← countRepeat - 1  
            END WHILE  
            ASSIGN numberIdx ← numberIdx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET outputString AS CONCATENATE elements of collectionOfChars SEQUENTIALLY  
        RETURN outputString  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            END IF  
        END FOR  

        DECLARE charList AS list of characters  
        SET charList TO KEYS OF freqMap  

        DECLARE descSortedChars AS list of characters  
        SET descSortedChars TO SORT charList BY (a, b) → (freqMap[b] - freqMap[a])  

        SET outputString TO EMPTY STRING

            DECLARE ch AS character ← descSortedChars[iterator]

            FOR repeatIndex FROM 1 TO count DO  
                SET tempString ← tempString + ch  
            END FOR  
            SET outputString ← outputString + tempString  
            SET iterator ← iterator + 1  
        END WHILE

END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findMinDifference(timePoints)  
        FUNCTION to_minutes(time)  
            SET components TO EMPTY LIST  
            SET pos TO 0  
            WHILE pos LESS THAN length of time  
                IF time[pos] EQUALS ":"  
                    EXIT WHILE  
                ELSE  
                    ADD time[pos] TO components  
                    SET pos TO pos + 1  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            SET colon_index TO pos  
            
            SET hrs_str TO SUBSTRING of time FROM 0 TO colon_index  
            SET mins_str TO SUBSTRING of time FROM colon_index + 1 TO length of time  
            
            SET hrs_num TO INTEGER parsed from hrs_str  
            SET mins_num TO INTEGER parsed from mins_str  
            RETURN hrs_num * 60 + mins_num  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET minute_values TO EMPTY LIST  
        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length of timePoints  
            ADD to_minutes(timePoints[idx]) TO minute_values  
            SET idx TO idx + 1  
        END WHILE
        
        CALL sort ON minute_values IN ASCENDING ORDER  
        
        SET shortest_gap TO INFINITY  
        SET pointer TO 1  
        WHILE pointer LESS THAN length of minute_values  
            SET gap TO minute_values[pointer] - minute_values[pointer - 1]  
            IF gap < shortest_gap THEN  
                SET shortest_gap TO gap  
            END IF  
            SET pointer TO pointer + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET wrap_gap TO 1440 - minute_values[length of minute_values - 1] + minute_values[0]  
        IF wrap_gap < shortest_gap THEN  
            SET shortest_gap TO wrap_gap  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN shortest_gap  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findIntegers(n)  
        ASSIGN binaryString ← ""  
        ASSIGN tempNumber ← n  
        WHILE tempNumber > 0  
            SET binaryString ← ( (tempNumber MOD 2) AS STRING ) + binaryString  
            SET tempNumber ← tempNumber DIV 2  
        END WHILE

        SET totalLength ← LENGTH OF binaryString  
        CREATE dp ARRAY WITH SIZE totalLength + 1 FILLED WITH 0  
        SET dp[0] ← 1  
        SET dp[1] ← 2  

        SET counter ← 2  
        WHILE counter ≤ totalLength  
            SET dp[counter] ← dp[counter - 1] + dp[counter - 2]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE

        SET accumulatedResult ← 0  
        SET lastBit ← 0  
        SET position ← 0  

        WHILE position < totalLength  
            SWITCH binaryString[position]  
                CASE '1':  
                    SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult + dp[totalLength - position - 1]  
                    IF lastBit = 1 THEN  
                        SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult - 1  
                        BREAK OUT OF LOOP  
                    END IF  
                    SET lastBit ← 1  
                DEFAULT:  
                    SET lastBit ← 0  
            END SWITCH  
            SET position ← position + 1  
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulatedResult + 1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

                END IF  
            END IF

        END FOR

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION scheduleCourse(courses)
        SORT courses BY course[1] IN ascending order
        INITIALIZE priority_queue AS an empty list
        SET accumulated_days TO 0
        
        INDEX idx = 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(courses) DO
            SET curr_course TO courses[idx]
            SET curr_duration TO curr_course[0]
            SET deadline TO curr_course[1]

            IF accumulated_days + curr_duration <= deadline THEN
                ADD -curr_duration INTO priority_queue USING heap push
                accumulated_days ← accumulated_days + curr_duration
            ELSE
                IF NOT (LENGTH(priority_queue) = 0) AND (-priority_queue[0]) > curr_duration THEN
                    accumulated_days ← accumulated_days + curr_duration + heap pop FROM priority_queue
                    ADD -curr_duration INTO priority_queue USING heap push
                END IF
            END IF

            idx ← idx + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN LENGTH(priority_queue)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION judgeSquareSum WITH parameter c  
        SET upperBound AS INTEGER PART OF THE SQUARE ROOT OF c  
        SET lowerBound AS 0  
        LOOP FOREVER  
            IF lowerBound GREATER THAN upperBound THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            SET total AS (upperBound * upperBound) + (lowerBound * lowerBound)  
            SWITCH total COMPARED TO c  
                CASE EQUAL:  
                    RETURN true  
                CASE LESS:  
                    SET lowerBound TO lowerBound + 1  
                CASE GREATER:  
                    SET upperBound TO upperBound - 1  
            END SWITCH  
        END LOOP  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION predictPartyVictory(senate)  
        DECLARE radiantQueue AS an empty double-ended queue  
        DECLARE direQueue AS an empty double-ended queue  

        INITIALIZE counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter IS LESS THAN LENGTH of senate  
            DECLARE partyChar AS senate[counter]  
            IF NOT (partyChar NOT EQUAL TO 'R')  
                APPEND counter TO radiantQueue  
            ELSE  
                APPEND counter TO direQueue  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        DECLARE radiantLen AS LENGTH of senate  

        LOOP INDEFINITELY  
            IF radiantQueue IS EMPTY OR direQueue IS EMPTY THEN  
                BREAK  
            END IF  

            REMOVE FIRST ELEMENT FROM radiantQueue AND ASSIGN TO radiantPos  
            REMOVE FIRST ELEMENT FROM direQueue AND ASSIGN TO direPos  

            IF radiantPos - direPos < 0 THEN  
                APPEND radiantPos + radiantLen TO radiantQueue  
            ELSE  
                APPEND direPos + radiantLen TO direQueue  
            END IF  
        END LOOP  

        IF radiantQueue IS EMPTY IS FALSE THEN  
            RETURN "Radiant"  
        END IF  
        RETURN "Dire"  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)  
        SET length_s1 AS LENGTH OF s1  
        SET length_s2 AS LENGTH OF s2  
        
        DECLARE dp AS LIST OF LISTS WITH (length_s1 + 1) ROWS AND (length_s2 + 1) COLUMNS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        SET idx_col TO 1  
        WHILE idx_col <= length_s2  
            LET previous_value BE dp[0][idx_col - 1]  
            LET ascii_code BE ASCII OF s2[idx_col - 1]  
            dp[0][idx_col] ← previous_value + ascii_code  
            idx_col ← idx_col + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET idx_row TO 1  
        WHILE idx_row <= length_s1  
            LET previous_value_row BE dp[idx_row - 1][0]  
            LET ascii_code_row BE ASCII OF s1[idx_row - 1]  
            dp[idx_row][0] ← previous_value_row + ascii_code_row  
            idx_row ← idx_row + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET outer_index TO 1  
        WHILE outer_index <= length_s1  
            SET inner_index TO 1  
            WHILE inner_index <= length_s2  
                LET char_s1 BE s1[outer_index - 1]  
                LET char_s2 BE s2[inner_index - 1]  
                IF char_s1 ≠ char_s2 THEN
                    LET deletion_s1 COST ← dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index] + ASCII OF char_s1  
                    LET deletion_s2 COST ← dp[outer_index][inner_index - 1] + ASCII OF char_s2  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE MINIMUM OF deletion_s1 COST AND deletion_s2 COST  
                ELSE  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index - 1]  
                END IF  
                inner_index ← inner_index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            outer_index ← outer_index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[length_s1][length_s2]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION canTransform(start parameter, end parameter)  
        INITIALIZE filteredStart AS empty list

            ASSIGN currentChar TO start parameter[posCounter]  
            IF NOT (currentChar = 'X') THEN  
                SET filteredStart TO filteredStart CONCATENATED WITH [(currentChar, posCounter)]  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT posCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE

        END WHILE

            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex < LENGTH(filteredStart) DO

            ASSIGN secondTuple TO filteredEnd[pairIndex]  

            ASSIGN charA TO firstTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posA TO firstTuple[1]  
            ASSIGN charB TO secondTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posB TO secondTuple[1]

                IF posA < posB THEN

                END IF  
            ELSE IF charA = 'R' THEN  
                IF posA > posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            SET pairIndex TO pairIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION reachingPoints(sx sx PARAMETER sy sy PARAMETER tx tx PARAMETER ty ty) RETURNS boolean
        LOOP_WHILE (tx IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sx) AND (ty IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sy)
            IF (NOT (tx IS_DIFFERS_FROM sx)) AND (NOT (ty IS_DIFFERS_FROM sy))
                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN ty
                IF ty IS_GREATER_THAN sy
                    LET dividend = tx
                    LET divisor = ty
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO tx
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = tx MINUS sx
                    LET denominator = ty
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            ELSE
                IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN sx
                    LET dividend = ty
                    LET divisor = tx
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO ty
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = ty MINUS sy
                    LET denominator = tx
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            END IF
        END LOOP_WHILE
        RETURN False
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        ASSIGN size TO LENGTH(graph)  
        ASSIGN paint TO ARRAY OF size ELEMENTS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(vertex, shade)  
            paint[vertex] = shade  
            SET index TO 0  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(graph[vertex])  
                ASSIGN adj TO graph[vertex][index]  
                IF paint[adj] == shade THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF paint[adj] == 0 THEN  
                    IF dfs(adj, -shade) == False THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                index = index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter < size  
            IF paint[counter] == 0 THEN  
                IF dfs(counter, 1) == False THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            counter = counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        END FOR

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION validTicTacToe(board)
        SET tallyAlpha TO 0
        SET lineBuffer TO 0

        WHILE lineBuffer LESS THAN LENGTH(board)
            SET currentLine TO board[lineBuffer]
            SET idxChar TO 0
            WHILE idxChar LESS THAN LENGTH(currentLine)
                IF currentLine[idxChar] EQUALS 'X'
                    SET tallyAlpha TO tallyAlpha + 1
                END IF
                SET idxChar TO idxChar + 1
            END WHILE
            SET lineBuffer TO lineBuffer + 1
        END WHILE

        SET tallyBeta TO 0
        SET scanRow TO 0

        WHILE scanRow LESS THAN LENGTH(board)
            SET currentSequence TO board[scanRow]
            SET posChar TO 0
            LOOP
                IF posChar GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO LENGTH(currentSequence)
                    BREAK
                END IF
                IF currentSequence[posChar] EQUALS 'O'
                    SET tallyBeta TO tallyBeta + 1
                END IF
                SET posChar TO posChar + 1
            END LOOP
            SET scanRow TO scanRow + 1
        END WHILE

        IF NOT (tallyAlpha GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO tallyBeta AND tallyAlpha LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO tallyBeta + 1)
            RETURN False
        END IF

        FUNCTION check_win(player)
            SET lineIndex TO 0
            WHILE lineIndex LESS THAN LENGTH(board)
                SET candidateRow TO board[lineIndex]
                IF candidateRow EQUALS player + player + player
                    RETURN True
                END IF
                SET lineIndex TO lineIndex + 1
            END WHILE

            SET columnIndex TO 0
            WHILE columnIndex LESS THAN 3
                IF board[0][columnIndex] EQUALS player
                   AND board[1][columnIndex] EQUALS player
                   AND board[2][columnIndex] EQUALS player
                    RETURN True
                END IF
                SET columnIndex TO columnIndex + 1
            END WHILE

            IF board[0][0] EQUALS player
               AND board[1][1] EQUALS player
               AND board[2][2] EQUALS player
                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF board[0][2] EQUALS player
               AND board[1][1] EQUALS player
               AND board[2][0] EQUALS player
                RETURN True
            END IF

            RETURN False
        END FUNCTION

        SET victoriousX TO check_win('X')
        SET victoriousO TO check_win('O')

        SELECT
            CASE victoriousX AND victoriousO
                RETURN False
            CASE victoriousX AND (tallyAlpha EQUALS tallyBeta)
                RETURN False
            CASE victoriousO AND (tallyAlpha NOT EQUALS tallyBeta)
                RETURN False
            DEFAULT
                RETURN True
        END SELECT
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION validTicTacToe(board)  
        SET countX TO zero  
        FOR each row IN board  
            INCREMENT countX BY the number of occurrences of character X in row  
        END FOR  
        SET countO TO zero  
        FOR each row IN board  
            INCREMENT countO BY the number of occurrences of character O in row  
        END FOR  

        IF countX LESS THAN countO OR countX GREATER THAN countO PLUS one  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  

        FUNCTION check_win(player)  
            FOR each row IN board  
                IF row EQUALS player repeated three times in succession  
                    RETURN True  
                END IF  
            END FOR  

            FOR col FROM zero TO two  
                IF element at position col of first row EQUALS player AND element at position col of second row EQUALS player AND element at position col of third row EQUALS player  
                    RETURN True  
                END IF  
            END FOR  

            IF element at position zero of first row EQUALS player AND element at position one of second row EQUALS player AND element at position two of third row EQUALS player  
                RETURN True  
            END IF  
            IF element at position two of first row EQUALS player AND element at position one of second row EQUALS player AND element at position zero of third row EQUALS player  
                RETURN True  
            END IF  
            RETURN False  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET winX TO result of invoking check_win with parameter character X  
        SET winO TO result of invoking check_win with parameter character O  

        IF winX AND winO  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  
        IF winX AND countX EQUALS countO  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  
        IF winO AND countX NOT EQUALS countO  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  

        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION soupServings(n)
        CASE
            WHEN n <= 4800 THEN
                SET n AS (n + 24) DIV 25
            ELSE
                RETURN 1.0
        END CASE

        SET cache AS empty dictionary

        FUNCTION dp(a, b)
            DEPLOY
                VARIABLE key AS (a, b)
            RETRIEVE
                IF key IN cache THEN
                    RETURN cache[key]
                END IF
            STOP

            IF a <= 0 THEN
                IF b <= 0 THEN
                    RETURN 0.5
                ELSE
                    RETURN 1.0
                END IF
            ELSE
                IF b <= 0 THEN
                    RETURN 0.0
                END IF
            END IF

            VARIABLE p1 AS dp(a - 4, b)
            VARIABLE p2 AS dp(a - 3, b - 1)
            VARIABLE p3 AS dp(a - 2, b - 2)
            VARIABLE p4 AS dp(a - 1, b - 3)

            VARIABLE prob AS 0.25 * (p1 + p2 + p3 + p4)
            SET cache[key] AS prob

            RETURN prob
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dp(n, n)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION soupServings(n)  
        IF n GREATER THAN four thousand eight hundred THEN  
            RETURN one point zero  
        END IF  
        SET n TO n PLUS twenty four DIVIDED BY twenty five  
        SET memo TO empty dictionary  
        FUNCTION dp(a, b)  
            IF tuple of a AND b EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN value of tuple of a AND b IN memo  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN zero point five  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN one point zero  
            END IF  
            IF b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN zero point zero  
            END IF  
            SET prob TO zero point two five MULTIPLIED BY sum of dp of a MINUS four AND b PLUS dp of a MINUS three AND b MINUS one PLUS dp of a MINUS two AND b MINUS two PLUS dp of a MINUS one AND b MINUS three  
            SET value of tuple of a AND b IN memo TO prob  
            RETURN prob  
        END FUNCTION  
        RETURN dp of n AND n  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF NOT (source NOT EQUAL target)  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE busMap AS a new empty mapping DefaultDict of list  
        SET i TO 0  
        WHILE i LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes  
            SET currentRoute TO routes[i]  
            SET j TO 0  
            WHILE j LESS THAN LENGTH OF currentRoute  
                APPEND i TO busMap[currentRoute[j]]  
                SET j TO j PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET i TO i PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE queue AS an empty double ended queue  
        INITIALIZE visitedBuses AS an empty set  
        INITIALIZE seenStops AS an empty set  

        FOR each busIndex IN busMap[source]  
            ENQUEUE (busIndex, 1) INTO queue  
            INSERT busIndex INTO visitedBuses  
        END FOR  
        INSERT source INTO seenStops  

        WHILE queue IS NOT EMPTY  
            DEQUEUE FROM queue INTO currentBus, currentCount  

            SET k TO 0  
            WHILE k LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes[currentBus]  
                SET currStop TO routes[currentBus][k]  

                IF currStop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN currentCount  
                END IF  

                IF currStop NOT IN seenStops  
                    INSERT currStop INTO seenStops  

                    FOR each nextBus IN busMap[currStop]  
                        IF nextBus NOT IN visitedBuses  
                            INSERT nextBus INTO visitedBuses  
                            ENQUEUE (nextBus, currentCount PLUS 1) INTO queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  

                SET k TO k PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF source EQUALS target  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  

        SET stop_to_buses TO an empty mapping from keys to empty lists  
        FOR each bus WITH index bus_index AND route IN routes  
            FOR each stop IN route  
                APPEND bus_index TO the list corresponding to stop IN stop_to_buses  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET bus_queue TO an empty double ended queue  
        SET visited_buses TO an empty set  
        SET visited_stops TO an empty set  

        FOR each bus IN the list of buses at the source stop FROM stop_to_buses  
            APPEND the tuple consisting of bus AND one TO bus_queue  
            ADD bus TO visited_buses  
            ADD source TO visited_stops  
        END FOR  

        WHILE bus_queue is not empty  
            REMOVE the first element FROM bus_queue AND ASSIGN the elements TO current_bus AND bus_count  

            FOR each stop IN the route at position current_bus OF routes  
                IF stop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN bus_count  
                END IF  

                IF stop NOT IN visited_stops  
                    ADD stop TO visited_stops  
                    FOR each next_bus IN the list of buses at stop FROM stop_to_buses  
                        IF next_bus NOT IN visited_buses  
                            ADD next_bus TO visited_buses  
                            APPEND the tuple consisting of next_bus AND bus_count PLUS one TO bus_queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET repeating TO empty set  
        DEFINE index AS 0  
        WHILE index LESS THAN the LENGTH OF fronts  
            SET front_val TO fronts[index]  
            SET back_val TO backs[index]  
            IF front_val EQUAL back_val THEN  
                ADD front_val TO repeating  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET combined_values TO empty set  
        FOR EACH val IN fronts DO  
            ADD val TO combined_values  
        END FOR  

        FOR EACH val IN backs DO  
            ADD val TO combined_values  
        END FOR  

        SET candidates TO empty set  
        FOR EACH val IN combined_values DO  
            IF NOT (val IN repeating) THEN  
                ADD val TO candidates  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        IF LENGTH OF candidates IS NOT EQUAL TO 0 THEN  
            SET result TO NULL  
            SET iterator TO candidates.iterator()  
            SET result TO iterator.next()  
            WHILE iterator.hasNext() DO  
                SET current_val TO iterator.next()  
                IF current_val LESS THAN result THEN  
                    SET result TO current_val  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestMountain(arr)
        SET length_arr AS LENGTH OF arr
        SET maximum_length TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 1
        LOOP
            IF NOT (index_counter < length_arr - 1) THEN
                BREAK
            END IF

            IF (arr[index_counter - 1] < arr[index_counter]) AND (arr[index_counter] > arr[index_counter + 1]) THEN
                SET left_marker AS index_counter - 1
                SET right_marker AS index_counter + 1

                WHILE (left_marker > 0) AND (arr[left_marker - 1] < arr[left_marker])
                    left_marker ← left_marker - 1
                END WHILE

                WHILE (right_marker < length_arr - 1) AND (arr[right_marker] > arr[right_marker + 1])
                    right_marker ← right_marker + 1
                END WHILE

                SET current_mountain_length AS right_marker - left_marker + 1
                IF maximum_length < current_mountain_length THEN
                    maximum_length ← current_mountain_length
                END IF

                index_counter ← right_marker
            ELSE
                index_counter ← index_counter + 1
            END IF
        END LOOP
        RETURN maximum_length
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION shortestPathLength(graph)
        IF NOT (graph == empty collection) THEN
            SET nodeCount AS LENGTH OF graph
            SET dequeContainer AS new double-ended queue
            SET index AS zero
            WHILE index LESS THAN nodeCount
                SET item AS pair(index, ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY index)
                APPEND item TO dequeContainer
                INCREMENT index BY one
            END WHILE

            SET visitedStates AS new set dequeContainer

            SET distance AS zero
            SET fullMask AS (ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY nodeCount) MINUS one

            WHILE NOT (dequeContainer IS EMPTY)
                SET levelSize AS LENGTH OF dequeContainer
                SET stepCounter AS zero
                WHILE stepCounter LESS THAN levelSize
                    REMOVE leftmost element FROM dequeContainer INTO currentPair
                    SET currentNode AS currentPair's first element
                    SET visitedMask AS currentPair's second element

                    IF visitedMask == fullMask THEN
                        RETURN distance
                    END IF

                    FOR each adjacent IN graph AT index currentNode
                        SET updatedMask AS visitedMask OR (ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY adjacent)
                        SET nextPair AS pair(adjacent, updatedMask)

                        IF NOT (nextPair IN visitedStates) THEN
                            ADD nextPair TO visitedStates
                            APPEND nextPair TO dequeContainer
                        END IF
                    END FOR
                    INCREMENT stepCounter BY one
                END WHILE
                SET distance AS distance + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN minus one
        ELSE
            RETURN zero
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION loudAndRich(richer, quiet)

            iterator ← iterator + 1

                    index ← index + 1
                END WHILE
            END IF
            RETURN answer[person]
        END FUNCTION

        counter ← 0
        WHILE counter < n
            dfs(counter)
            counter ← counter + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN answer
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION carFleet(target, position, speed)

                SET fleetCount TO fleetCount PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT timeIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN fleetCount  
    END FUNCTION

            END WHILE

        RETURN tests  
    END FUNCTION

        SET pair_and_count TO a new default dictionary of integers  
        FOR each element i IN nums  
            FOR each element j IN nums  
                SET current_key TO the bitwise AND of i AND j  
                INCREMENT the value at current_key in pair_and_count BY one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET triplet_count TO zero  
        FOR each element k IN nums  
            FOR each key pair_and and associated count IN pair_and_count items  
                IF the bitwise AND of pair_and AND k EQUALS zero THEN  
                    INCREMENT triplet_count BY count  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN triplet_count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION gridIllumination(n, lamps, queries)  
        INITIALIZE freqRows AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE freqCols AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE freqDiags AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE freqAntiDiags AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE activeLamps AS an empty set  
        
        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(lamps)  
            LET x TO lamps[idx][0]  
            LET y TO lamps[idx][1]  
            IF NOT (x, y) IN activeLamps  
                INSERT (x, y) INTO activeLamps  
                freqRows[x] ← freqRows[x] + 1  
                freqCols[y] ← freqCols[y] + 1  
                LET dKey TO x - y  
                LET adKey TO x + y  
                freqDiags[dKey] ← freqDiags[dKey] + 1  
                freqAntiDiags[adKey] ← freqAntiDiags[adKey] + 1  
            END IF  
            idx ← idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        DECLARE neighbors AS a list containing (-1, -1), (-1, 0), (-1, 1), (0, -1), (0, 0), (0, 1), (1, -1), (1, 0), (1, 1)  
        
        DEFINE results AS an empty list  
        
        SET qIndex TO 0  
        WHILE qIndex < LENGTH(queries)  
            LET currRow TO queries[qIndex][0]  
            LET currCol TO queries[qIndex][1]  
            
            IF freqRows[currRow] > 0 OR freqCols[currCol] > 0 OR freqDiags[currRow - currCol] > 0 OR freqAntiDiags[currRow + currCol] > 0 THEN  
                APPEND 1 TO results  
            ELSE  
                APPEND 0 TO results  
            END IF  
            
            DECLARE nIndex AS 0  
            WHILE nIndex < LENGTH(neighbors)  
                LET deltaRow TO neighbors[nIndex][0]  
                LET deltaCol TO neighbors[nIndex][1]  
                LET newRow TO currRow + deltaRow  
                LET newCol TO currCol + deltaCol  
                
                IF (newRow, newCol) IN activeLamps THEN  
                    DELETE (newRow, newCol) FROM activeLamps  
                    freqRows[newRow] ← freqRows[newRow] - 1  
                    freqCols[newCol] ← freqCols[newCol] - 1  
                    freqDiags[newRow - newCol] ← freqDiags[newRow - newCol] - 1  
                    freqAntiDiags[newRow + newCol] ← freqAntiDiags[newRow + newCol] - 1  
                END IF  
                nIndex ← nIndex + 1  
            END WHILE  
            qIndex ← qIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN results  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION dieSimulator(n, rollMax)
        SET MOD TO 1000000007

        SET dp TO list of size (n + 1), EACH element a list of size 6, EACH element a list of zeros of size (max element in rollMax + 1)

        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx LESS_THAN 6
            SET temp_list TO dp[1][idx]
            temp_list[1] ← 1
            idx ← idx + 1
        END WHILE

        SET i TO 2
        WHILE i LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL n
            SET j TO 0
            WHILE j LESS_THAN 6
                SET k TO 1
                WHILE k LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL rollMax[j]
                    IF k LESS_THAN 2
                        SET acc TO 0
                        SET x TO 0
                        WHILE x LESS_THAN 6
                            IF x NOT_EQUALS j THEN
                                SET y TO 1
                                WHILE y LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL rollMax[x]
                                    acc ← acc + dp[i - 1][x][y]
                                    y ← y + 1
                                END WHILE
                            END IF
                            x ← x + 1
                        END WHILE
                        dp[i][j][k] ← acc MOD MOD
                    ELSE
                        dp[i][j][k] ← dp[i - 1][j][k - 1]
                    END IF
                    k ← k + 1
                END WHILE
                j ← j + 1
            END WHILE
            i ← i + 1
        END WHILE

        SET final_result TO 0  
        FOR INDEX j FROM 0 TO 5
            SET subIdx TO 1
            WHILE subIdx LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL rollMax[j]
                ADD dp[n][j][subIdx] TO final_result
                subIdx ← subIdx + 1
            END WHILE  
        END FOR

        RETURN final_result MOD MOD
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION maxValueAfterReverse(nums)

        IF NOT (lengthCounter GREATER THAN 2) THEN
            ASSIGN ABS(nums[0] - nums[1]) TO resultVal
            RETURN resultVal
        END IF

            ASSIGN ABS(nums[0] - nums[pointerA]) - ABS(nums[pointerA] - nums[pointerA - 1]) TO candidateGainA

                ASSIGN candidateGainA TO edgeMaxGain
            END IF
            ASSIGN pointerA + 1 TO pointerA
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN 0 TO pointerB
        WHILE pointerB LESS THAN lengthCounter - 1
            ASSIGN ABS(nums[lengthCounter - 1] - nums[pointerB]) - ABS(nums[pointerB + 1] - nums[pointerB]) TO candidateGainB
            IF candidateGainB GREATER THAN edgeMaxGain THEN
                ASSIGN candidateGainB TO edgeMaxGain
            END IF
            ASSIGN pointerB + 1 TO pointerB
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN +Infinity TO minMaxPair

    FUNCTION maxValueAfterReverse(nums)

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION kthSmallest(mat AS List OF List OF Integer k AS Integer) RETURNS Integer  
        LET rowCount BE LENGTH OF mat  
        LET colCount BE LENGTH OF FIRST ELEMENT IN mat  
        LET baseSum BE 0  
        LET accumulator BE 0  
        WHILE accumulator < rowCount  
            baseSum ← baseSum + mat[accumulator][0]  
            accumulator ← accumulator + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        LET startIndices BE A TUPLE WITH rowCount COPIES OF 0  
        LET heapList BE A LIST CONTAINING (baseSum, startIndices)  
        LET seenIndices BE A SET CONTAINING startIndices  
        
        LOOP UNTIL k IS 0  
            EXTRACT (currentSum, currentIndices) FROM heapList BY REMOVING SMALLEST ELEMENT  
            k ← k - 1  
            
            IF k = 0 THEN RETURN currentSum END IF  
            
            LET position BE 0  
            WHILE position < rowCount DO  
                LET currentIndexValue BE currentIndices[position]  
                IF currentIndexValue + 1 < colCount THEN  
                    LET tempIndices BE CONVERT_TO_LIST(currentIndices)  
                    LET tempIndexValue BE tempIndices[position] + 1  
                    tempIndices[position] ← tempIndexValue  
                    LET nextIndices BE CONVERT_TO_TUPLE(tempIndices)  
                    
                    LET replacedSumPart BE mat[position][currentIndexValue]  
                    LET newSumPart BE mat[position][tempIndexValue]  
                    LET updatedSum BE currentSum - replacedSumPart + newSumPart  
                    
                    IF nextIndices NOT IN seenIndices THEN  
                        ADD nextIndices TO seenIndices  
                        ADD (updatedSum, nextIndices) TO heapList  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                position ← position + 1  
            END WHILE  
        END LOOP  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maxDotProduct(nums1 PARAMETER, nums2 PARAMETER)  
        SET length1 AS LENGTH OF nums1  
        SET length2 AS LENGTH OF nums2  
        CREATE dp AS LIST OF LISTS  
        FOR index1 FROM 0 TO length1  
            CREATE row AS LIST  
            FOR index2 FROM 0 TO length2  
                APPEND NEGATIVE_INFINITY TO row  
            END FOR  
            APPEND row TO dp  
        END FOR  

        SET outerCounter TO 1  
        WHILE outerCounter <= length1  
            SET innerCounter TO 1  
            WHILE innerCounter <= length2  
                SET productCurrent TO (nums1[outerCounter - 1]) * (nums2[innerCounter - 1])  
                SET choice1 TO productCurrent  
                SET choice2 TO dp[outerCounter - 1][innerCounter]  
                SET choice3 TO dp[outerCounter][innerCounter - 1]  
                SET choice4 TO dp[outerCounter - 1][innerCounter - 1] + productCurrent  
                
                SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] TO choice1  
                IF choice2 > dp[outerCounter][innerCounter]  
                    SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] TO choice2  
                END IF  
                IF choice3 > dp[outerCounter][innerCounter]  
                    SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] TO choice3  
                END IF  
                IF choice4 > dp[outerCounter][innerCounter]  
                    SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] TO choice4  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT innerCounter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN dp[length1][length2]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumIncompatibility(nums k)  
        LET totalElements ← LENGTH nums  
        LET sizePerSubset ← totalElements DIV k  
        LET elementCounts ← COUNT ELEMENTS IN nums  
        
        FOR countValue IN elementCounts.VALUES  
            IF countValue > k THEN RETURN -1  
        END FOR  
        
        LET incompatibilityMap ← EMPTY DICTIONARY  
        LET maxMask ← (2 POWER totalElements) - 1  
        LET currentMask ← 0  
        
        WHILE currentMask <= maxMask DO  
            LET bitsSet ← COUNT OF BITS SET IN currentMask  
            
            IF bitsSet = sizePerSubset THEN  
                LET collected ← EMPTY LIST  
                LET index ← 0  
                
                WHILE index < totalElements DO  
                    IF (currentMask BITWISE-AND (2 POWER index)) ≠ 0 THEN  
                        collected.APPEND(nums[index])  
                    END IF  
                    index ← index + 1  
                END WHILE  
                
                LET uniqueElements ← SET OF collected  
                IF LENGTH uniqueElements = sizePerSubset THEN  
                    LET maxVal ← MAX OF collected  
                    LET minVal ← MIN OF collected  
                    LET diff ← maxVal - minVal  
                    incompatibilityMap[currentMask] ← diff  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            
            currentMask ← currentMask + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        LET dpArray ← ARRAY OF SIZE (2 POWER totalElements) FILLED WITH INFINITY  
        dpArray[0] ← 0  
        
        FOR maskValue FROM 0 TO maxMask DO  
            IF (COUNT OF BITS SET IN maskValue) MOD sizePerSubset ≠ 0 THEN CONTINUE  
            
            FOR each candidateSubset IN incompatibilityMap.KEYS DO  
                IF (maskValue BITWISE-AND candidateSubset) = candidateSubset THEN  
                    LET attempt ← dpArray[maskValue - candidateSubset] + incompatibilityMap[candidateSubset]  
                    IF attempt < dpArray[maskValue] THEN  
                        dpArray[maskValue] ← attempt  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        LET fullSetMask ← maxMask  
        IF dpArray[fullSetMask] ≠ INFINITY THEN  
            RETURN dpArray[fullSetMask]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION minimumIncompatibility(nums k)

                    END IF

        ELSE

    END FUNCTION

                END IF
                DECREASE bit_pos BY 1
            END WHILE

            ASSIGN answers[q_index] TO xor_max
            INCREMENT idx BY 1
        END WHILE

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION countDifferentSubsequenceGCDs(nums)

                    END IF  
                END IF

            END LOOP  
            SET g_index ← g_index + 1  
        END WHILE

                IF (m = row) THEN  
                    SET valid_columns ← valid_columns + [(col)]  
                    RETURN  
                END IF  
                
                SET index ← 0  
                WHILE index < LENGTH(palette) DO  
                    SET current_color ← palette[index]

                            SET index ← index + 1  
                            CONTINUE  
                        END IF  
                        
                        SET col ← col + [current_color]  
                        CALL backtrack(col, row + 1)  
                        SET col ← col[0 : LENGTH(col) - 1]  
                    END IF  
                    SET index ← index + 1  
                END WHILE  
            END FUNCTION  
            
            CALL backtrack([], 0)  
            RETURN valid_columns  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET all_valid_cols ← generate_valid_columns(null)  
        SET total_valid_cols ← LENGTH(all_valid_cols)  
        
        SET compatible_cols ← DICTIONARY()

            SET pos_j ← 0

                SET compatible ← true  
                SET pos_k ← 0

            SET pos_i ← pos_i + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET dp ← []

            SET dp ← dp + [1]  
            SET idx ← idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET iteration ← 1  
        WHILE iteration < n DO  
            SET next_dp ← []  
            SET jdx ← 0

                SET next_dp ← next_dp + [0]

            SET iteration ← iteration + 1

    FUNCTION colorTheGrid(m PARAMETER n PARAMETER)

                    END IF

            END FUNCTION

        END FUNCTION

        END FOR  
        
        SET total_ways TO zero  
        FOR each value IN dp  
            INCREMENT total_ways BY value  
        END FOR

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maximumGood(statements)
        ASSIGN n AS LENGTH(statements)
        LET maximumCount BE 0
        LET mask BE 0
        WHILE mask < (1 << n)
            DECLARE truthful AS ARRAY OF n ELEMENTS FILLED WITH FALSE
            DECLARE deceitful AS ARRAY OF n ELEMENTS FILLED WITH FALSE
            LET position BE 0
            REPEAT UNTIL position = n
                LET bitmask BE (1 << position)
                IF (mask & bitmask) = bitmask THEN
                    truthful[position] ← TRUE
                ELSE
                    deceitful[position] ← TRUE
                END IF
                position ← position + 1
            END REPEAT
            LET isConsistent BE TRUE
            LET idx BE 0
            WHILE idx < n AND isConsistent
                IF truthful[idx] = TRUE THEN
                    LET innerIdx BE 0
                    REPEAT UNTIL innerIdx = n OR NOT isConsistent
                        LET statementValue BE statements[idx][innerIdx]
                        IF (statementValue = 0 AND truthful[innerIdx] = TRUE) OR (statementValue = 1 AND deceitful[innerIdx] = TRUE) THEN
                            isConsistent ← FALSE
                        END IF
                        innerIdx ← innerIdx + 1
                    END REPEAT
                END IF
                idx ← idx + 1
            END WHILE
            IF isConsistent THEN
                LET countTruthful BE 0
                FOR countIdx FROM 0 TO n - 1
                    IF truthful[countIdx] = TRUE THEN
                        countTruthful ← countTruthful + 1
                    END IF
                END FOR
                IF countTruthful > maximumCount THEN
                    maximumCount ← countTruthful
                END IF
            END IF
            mask ← mask + 1
        END WHILE
        RETURN maximumCount
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION subStrHash(s string power integer modulo integer k integer hashValue integer) RETURNS string  
        FUNCTION val(c character) RETURNS integer  
            RETURN (UNICODE(c) - UNICODE('a')) + 1  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET length_s AS LENGTH(s)  
        SET rolling_hash TO 0  
        SET multiplier TO 1  

        SET idx TO length_s - k  
        WHILE idx < length_s  
            SET char_val TO val(s[idx])  
            SET rolling_hash TO (rolling_hash + (char_val * multiplier) MOD modulo) MOD modulo  
            IF idx < length_s - 1 THEN  
                SET multiplier TO (multiplier * power) MOD modulo  
            END IF  
            SET idx TO idx + 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET substring_start TO length_s - k  
        IF rolling_hash = hashValue THEN  
            RETURN SUBSTRING(s, substring_start, length_s - 1)  
        END IF  

        SET highest_power TO multiplier  

        SET j TO length_s - k - 1  
        WHILE j >= 0  
            SET removed_char_val TO val(s[j + k])  
            SET rolling_hash TO rolling_hash - (removed_char_val * highest_power)  
            SET rolling_hash TO rolling_hash MOD modulo  
            IF rolling_hash < 0 THEN  
                SET rolling_hash TO rolling_hash + modulo  
            END IF  
            SET rolling_hash TO ((rolling_hash * power) + val(s[j])) MOD modulo  

            IF rolling_hash = hashValue THEN  
                SET substring_start TO j  
            END IF  
            SET j TO j - 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN SUBSTRING(s, substring_start, substring_start + k - 1)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET n TO the LENGTH OF string s

        FOR i FROM n MINUS k TO n MINUS one  
            SET current_hash TO current_hash PLUS val(the element at position i of s) MULTIPLIED BY p_pow MODULO modulo  
            IF i LESS THAN n MINUS one

            RETURN the substring from position start_index TO the position one LESS THAN n of s

            IF current_hash EQUALS hashValue

            END IF

            APPEND (cityA, tollAmt) TO graph[cityB]

            IF highways_used IS k THEN

                END IF  
  
                INSERT adj_city INTO visited  
                CALL dfs(adj_city, visited, cost + adj_toll, highways_used + 1)  
                DELETE adj_city FROM visited  
  
                INCREMENT neighbor_idx BY one  
            END WHILE

        ASSIGN max_cost TO -1  
        SET current_city TO 0  
        WHILE current_city NOT EQUAL n DO  
            ASSIGN visited TO a set containing current_city  
            CALL dfs(current_city, visited, 0, 0)  
            INCREMENT current_city BY one  
        END WHILE

    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maximumMinutes(grid)
        SET rowCount AS LENGTH OF grid
        SET colCount AS LENGTH OF element AT 0 OF grid
        SET moves AS LIST OF PAIRS: (1, 0), (-1, 0), (0, 1), (0, -1)

        FUNCTION can_escape(wait)
            SET fireArrival TO a 2D LIST sized rowCount BY colCount FILLED WITH infinity
            CREATE deque AS empty double-ended queue

            SET iCounter TO 0
            WHILE iCounter < rowCount
                SET jCounter TO 0
                WHILE jCounter < colCount
                    IF element AT iCounter OF grid = 1 THEN
                        PUSH (iCounter, jCounter, 0) TO deque
                        ASSIGN fireArrival[iCounter][jCounter] ← 0
                    END IF
                    INCREMENT jCounter BY 1
                END WHILE
                INCREMENT iCounter BY 1
            END WHILE

            WHILE deque IS NOT empty
                POP_LEFT (currX, currY, currTime) FROM deque
                FOR EACH (dx, dy) IN moves DO
                    SET nextX TO currX + dx
                    SET nextY TO currY + dy
                    IF (nextX ≥ 0) AND (nextX < rowCount) AND (nextY ≥ 0) AND (nextY < colCount) AND (grid[nextX][nextY] = 0) AND (fireArrival[nextX][nextY] = infinity) THEN
                        ASSIGN fireArrival[nextX][nextY] ← currTime + 1
                        PUSH (nextX, nextY, currTime + 1) TO deque
                    END IF
                END FOR
            END WHILE

            SET explorerQueue TO new double-ended queue WITH ELEMENT (0, 0, wait)
            SET visitedSet TO SET CONTAINING PAIR (0, 0)

            WHILE explorerQueue IS NOT empty
                POP_LEFT (posX, posY, timePassed) FROM explorerQueue
                FOR EACH (offsetX, offsetY) IN moves DO
                    SET candidateX TO posX + offsetX
                    SET candidateY TO posY + offsetY
                    IF (candidateX ≥ 0) AND (candidateX < rowCount) AND (candidateY ≥ 0) AND (candidateY < colCount) AND NOT ((candidateX, candidateY) IN visitedSet) AND (grid[candidateX][candidateY] = 0) THEN
                        IF (candidateX = rowCount - 1) AND (candidateY = colCount - 1) THEN
                            IF fireArrival[candidateX][candidateY] ≥ timePassed + 1 THEN
                                RETURN true
                            ELSE
                                RETURN false
                            END IF
                        END IF
                        IF fireArrival[candidateX][candidateY] > timePassed + 1 THEN
                            ADD (candidateX, candidateY) TO visitedSet
                            PUSH (candidateX, candidateY, timePassed + 1) TO explorerQueue
                        END IF
                    END IF
                END FOR
            END WHILE

            RETURN false
        END FUNCTION

        SET startPos TO 0
        SET endPos TO rowCount * colCount
        SET answer TO -1

        WHILE startPos ≤ endPos
            SET middle TO startPos + FLOOR((endPos - startPos) / 2)
            IF can_escape(middle) THEN
                ASSIGN answer ← middle
                ASSIGN startPos ← middle + 1
            ELSE
                ASSIGN endPos ← middle - 1
            END IF
        END WHILE

        IF answer ≠ rowCount * colCount THEN
            RETURN answer
        ELSE
            RETURN 1000000000
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        
        IF result NOT EQUALS m MULTIPLIED BY n  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN one followed by nine zeros  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION largestVariance(s)  
        FUNCTION calculate_variance(substring, char_a, char_b)  
            SET peak_variance ← 0  
            SET tally_a ← 0  
            SET tally_b ← 0  
            SET observed_b ← false  
            SET encountered_first_b ← false  
            
            SET iterator ← 0  
            WHILE iterator < LENGTH(substring)  
                SET current_char ← substring[iterator]  
                IF current_char = char_a THEN  
                    tally_a ← tally_a + 1  
                ELSE  
                    IF current_char = char_b THEN  
                        tally_b ← tally_b + 1  
                        observed_b ← true  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                
                IF NOT (tally_b ≤ 0) THEN  
                    IF peak_variance < (tally_a - tally_b) THEN  
                        peak_variance ← tally_a - tally_b  
                    END IF  
                ELSE  
                    IF (tally_b = 0) AND encountered_first_b THEN  
                        IF peak_variance < (tally_a - 1) THEN  
                            peak_variance ← tally_a - 1  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                
                IF tally_b > tally_a THEN  
                    SET tally_a ← 0  
                    SET tally_b ← 0  
                    SET encountered_first_b ← observed_b  
                END IF  
                
                iterator ← iterator + 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            RETURN peak_variance  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET overall_max ← 0  
        SET character_pool ← EMPTY SET  
        SET index ← 0  
        WHILE index < LENGTH(s)  
            character_pool ← character_pool UNION { s[index] }  
            index ← index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET unique_list ← LIST(character_pool)  
        SET n ← LENGTH(unique_list)  
        SET outer_index ← 0  
        WHILE outer_index < n  
            SET inner_index ← 0  
            WHILE inner_index < n  
                IF outer_index ≠ inner_index THEN  
                    SET candidate_a ← unique_list[outer_index]  
                    SET candidate_b ← unique_list[inner_index]  
                    SET probe_variance ← calculate_variance(s, candidate_a, candidate_b)  
                    IF probe_variance > overall_max THEN  
                        overall_max ← probe_variance  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                inner_index ← inner_index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            outer_index ← outer_index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN overall_max  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION shoppingOffers(price, special, needs)
        SET filtered_special TO empty collection
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(special)
            SET bundle TO special[idx]
            SET sum_items TO 0
            SET total_value TO 0
            SET pos TO 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(bundle) - 1
                SET sum_items TO sum_items + bundle[pos]
                SET total_value TO total_value + bundle[pos] * price[pos]
                INCREMENT pos BY 1
            END WHILE
            IF sum_items > 0 AND bundle[LENGTH(bundle) - 1] < total_value THEN
                APPEND bundle TO filtered_special
            END IF
            INCREMENT idx BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        FUNCTION dfs(current_needs)
            SET minimal_cost TO 0
            DECLARE counter AS 0
            WHILE counter < LENGTH(price)
                SET minimal_cost TO minimal_cost + price[counter] * current_needs[counter]
                INCREMENT counter BY 1
            END WHILE
            
            SET offer_index TO 0
            WHILE offer_index < LENGTH(filtered_special)
                SET offer_bundle TO filtered_special[offer_index]
                SET updated_needs TO empty collection
                FOR position IN 0 TO LENGTH(current_needs) - 1
                    APPEND current_needs[position] - offer_bundle[position] TO updated_needs
                END FOR
                
                SET eligible TO TRUE
                FOR demand IN updated_needs
                    IF demand < 0 THEN
                        SET eligible TO FALSE
                        EXIT FOR
                    END IF
                END FOR
                
                IF eligible THEN
                    SET cost_if_used TO offer_bundle[LENGTH(offer_bundle) - 1] + dfs(CONVERT_TO_TUPLE(updated_needs))
                    IF cost_if_used < minimal_cost THEN
                        SET minimal_cost TO cost_if_used
                    END IF
                END IF
                
                INCREMENT offer_index BY 1
            END WHILE
            
            RETURN minimal_cost
        END FUNCTION
        
        RETURN dfs(CONVERT_TO_TUPLE(needs))
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION shoppingOffers(price, special, needs)  
        SET special TO an empty list  
        FOR each offer IN the original special list  
            IF the sum of elements at all positions except the last in offer IS GREATER THAN zero AND  
               the last element of offer IS LESS THAN the sum of the product of corresponding elements of price and offer except the last element  
                APPEND offer TO special  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(needs)  
            SET min_cost TO zero  
            FOR each element at position index FROM zero TO the length of price MINUS one  
                INCREMENT min_cost BY the element at position index of price MULTIPLIED BY the element at position index of needs  
            END FOR  
            
            FOR each offer IN special  
                SET new_needs TO an empty list  
                FOR each index FROM zero TO the length of needs MINUS one  
                    APPEND to new_needs the element at position index of needs MINUS the element at position index of offer  
                END FOR  
                
                SET can_use_offer TO true  
                FOR each element n IN new_needs  
                    IF n IS LESS THAN zero  
                        SET can_use_offer TO false  
                        BREAK the loop  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
                
                IF can_use_offer EQUALS true  
                    SET possible_cost TO the last element of offer PLUS dfs(the tuple version of new_needs)  
                    IF possible_cost IS LESS THAN min_cost  
                        SET min_cost TO possible_cost  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN min_cost  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN dfs(the tuple version of needs)  
    END FUNCTION
